instruction: What machine learning models were used for data processing of the dual-channel fluorescence sensor array in this study?
Output: The machine learning models used for data processing of the dual-channel fluorescence sensor array in this study were Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) and Support Vector Machine (SVM).

instruction: Can the dual-channel fluorescence sensor array based on carbon quantum dots (CDs) be used to detect and differentiate between tetracyclines (TCs) in real samples such as river water and milk?
Output: Yes, the dual-channel fluorescence sensor array based on carbon quantum dots (CDs) can be used to detect and differentiate between tetracyclines (TCs) in real samples such as river water and milk. The array has been successfully used to accurately detect and identify TCs in river water and milk samples, as mentioned in the provided text.
